content.question: In the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane, the position of a particle at time <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> is given by the parametric function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> defined by <math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses equals open parentheses x open parentheses t close parentheses comma y open parentheses t close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math> for <math alttext="t greater or equal than 0"><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. Both <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> and <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math> are polynomial functions and <math alttext="a complex fraction with complex fraction numerator fraction numerator y open parentheses 5 close parentheses minus y open parentheses 3 close parentheses over denominator 5 minus 3 end fraction over complex fraction denominator fraction numerator x open parentheses 5 close parentheses minus x open parentheses 3 close parentheses over denominator 5 minus 3 end fraction end complex fraction equals 4"><mfrac><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mn>5</mn></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mn>3</mn></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mn>5</mn></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mn>3</mn></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math>. Which of the following is true about the slope of the segment connecting the two points on the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> for times <math alttext="t equals 3"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math> and <math alttext="t equals 5"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math> ?

choices.label: The slope of the segment is <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> because <math alttext="a complex fraction with complex fraction numerator fraction numerator y open parentheses 5 close parentheses minus y open parentheses 3 close parentheses over denominator 5 minus 3 end fraction over complex fraction denominator fraction numerator x open parentheses 5 close parentheses minus x open parentheses 3 close parentheses over denominator 5 minus 3 end fraction end complex fraction"><mfrac><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mn>5</mn></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mn>3</mn></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mn>5</mn></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mn>3</mn></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></mfrac></math> gives the ratio of the average rate of change of <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math> with respect to <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> and the average rate of change of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> with respect to <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math>, which needs to be divided by <math alttext="5 minus 3 equals 2"><mn>5</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math> to get the average rate of change of <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math> with respect to <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>.

The slope of the segment is <math alttext="4"><mn>4</mn></math> because <math alttext="a complex fraction with complex fraction numerator fraction numerator y open parentheses 5 close parentheses minus y open parentheses 3 close parentheses over denominator 5 minus 3 end fraction over complex fraction denominator fraction numerator x open parentheses 5 close parentheses minus x open parentheses 3 close parentheses over denominator 5 minus 3 end fraction end complex fraction"><mfrac><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mn>5</mn></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mn>3</mn></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mn>5</mn></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mn>3</mn></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></mfrac></math> gives the ratio of the average rate of change of <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math> with respect to <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> and the average rate of change of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> with respect to <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math>, which is equivalent to the average rate of change of <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math> with respect to <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>.

The slope of the segment is <math alttext="8"><mn>8</mn></math> because <math alttext="a complex fraction with complex fraction numerator fraction numerator y open parentheses 5 close parentheses minus y open parentheses 3 close parentheses over denominator 5 minus 3 end fraction over complex fraction denominator fraction numerator x open parentheses 5 close parentheses minus x open parentheses 3 close parentheses over denominator 5 minus 3 end fraction end complex fraction"><mfrac><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mn>5</mn></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mn>3</mn></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mn>5</mn></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mn>3</mn></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></mfrac></math> gives the ratio of the average rate of change of <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math> with respect to <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> and the average rate of change of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> with respect to <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math>, which needs to be multiplied by <math alttext="5 minus 3 equals 2"><mn>5</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math> to get the average rate of change of <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math> with respect to <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>.

The slope of the segment cannot be determined because <math alttext="a complex fraction with complex fraction numerator fraction numerator y open parentheses 5 close parentheses minus y open parentheses 3 close parentheses over denominator 5 minus 3 end fraction over complex fraction denominator fraction numerator x open parentheses 5 close parentheses minus x open parentheses 3 close parentheses over denominator 5 minus 3 end fraction end complex fraction"><mfrac><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mn>5</mn></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mn>3</mn></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mn>5</mn></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mn>3</mn></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></mfrac></math> does not provide the position of the particle at times <math alttext="t equals 3"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math> and <math alttext="t equals 5"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math>, but rather only relative rates of <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> and <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> at times <math alttext="t equals 3"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math> and <math alttext="t equals 5"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math>.

content.answer: The slope of the segment is <math alttext="4"><mn>4</mn></math> because <math alttext="a complex fraction with complex fraction numerator fraction numerator y open parentheses 5 close parentheses minus y open parentheses 3 close parentheses over denominator 5 minus 3 end fraction over complex fraction denominator fraction numerator x open parentheses 5 close parentheses minus x open parentheses 3 close parentheses over denominator 5 minus 3 end fraction end complex fraction"><mfrac><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mn>5</mn></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mn>3</mn></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mn>5</mn></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mn>3</mn></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></mfrac></math> gives the ratio of the average rate of change of <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math> with respect to <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> and the average rate of change of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> with respect to <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math>, which is equivalent to the average rate of change of <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math> with respect to <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>.

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

topic.text: 4.3: Parametric Functions and Rates of Change

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Support conclusions or choices with a logical rationale or appropriate data.
